channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023120397
item.description:
Report X-2023120397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by bay door 35, having already been placed in hazmat spill tote. DescribePack: Package was wet on bottom. Upon inspection of contents, 1 jug of sanitizer was found to have a loose/cracked cap, causing roughly half of its contents to spill out and cover remaining 3 jugs in corrosive liquid. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: No apparent spillage was found to clean up. Package was removed from work area and placed in secure hazmat storage area.

item.title: Report X-2023120431
item.description:
Report X-2023120431

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler picked package up by the handles, which ripped due to the weight of the box. The uneven weight caused her to partially drop the package and carried it to the trailer on its side. Package handler was notified that the package was leaking and she put it down and the damage was called out for immediate cleanup and processing. DescribePack: Caps were loose and it was noted that the bottles were packed pretty tightly inside with no inner partitions/separations. When the bottles were removed from the box, the sound of air hissing out from the caps was heard due to them being pressed together tightly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a spill liner/tote and taken away to be processed and spillage was cleaned up with spill absorbent.

X-2023120420 equenceEvent: DOING REGULAR DAILY HAZMAT CAGE CHECK AND CAME UPON RED HAZMAT TOTE WITH BOX IN PLASTIC BAG DescribePack: TOP OF BOTTLE CAP CAME LOOSE CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED BOX IN RED HAZMAT TOTE WITH PLASTIC BAG TO CAPTURE LIQUID.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was noticed that the box was wet, we got the package and placed it in a Hazmat tote and it was taken to the cage DescribePack: Of the 4 jugs this was the only jug with a seal under the lid, but the seal had a small hole in it. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: We sat the box upright so it wouldnt be on its side to leak and placed in the hazmat tote.

item.title: Report I-2023120008
item.description:
Report I-2023120008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: Delphi
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was unloading the product into the customer's tank while a customer's employee was monitoring the gauge on the tank(because the gauge was not visible from the truck). The customer's employee told our driver that a leak developed in the line and the product was flowing into containment. PVS driver stopped the flow of product. There was around 100 gallons that flowed into containment in the span of 2 minutes.

item.title: Report X-2023120150
item.description:
Report X-2023120150

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a closed hazmat tote; seems to have been picked up from customer after being delivered. This package appeared after so long that it is no longer on file in our system. I have kept package enclosed in hazmat tote using gloves. DescribePack: Cans of epoxy inside are leaking from lids, appears to have been bent and dented at sides causing failure, approximately 1 ounce has leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red hazmat tote with a blue liner.

item.title: Report X-2023120149
item.description:
Report X-2023120149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at front of van line near NC belt. Plastic pail of Steris CIP 100 detergent was sitting in a puddle of its own contents. Package appeared to have either fallen off of a cart or been dropped/mishandled. DescribePack: Plastic pail was dented/cracked on bottom, causing moderate leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spillage was cleaned up with absorbent powder and leaking hazmat placed in hazmat spill tote. No contact was made with skin.

item.title: Report E-2023120130
item.description:
Report E-2023120130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: WEST LAFAYETTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During transportation a passenger vehicle flagged the driver down. The driver pulled over and he was notified that there was a spray coming from the trailer. the driver inspected the trailer again and found that a cleanout cap was missing from the top of the trailer. The spray had gotten on the passenger vehicle. The local county Sherriff reported to the scene. The liquid that was released was evaporating very quickly and no residue was collecting on the ground. We had a response team show up to the scene they were able to bring a new cap for the cleanout and the driver was on his way. The driver of the personal vehicle later reported that her and her child was exposed to the material because there window was down when they were behind our vehicle and that they went to there physician and was told to go to the ER. I have not been able to get an update on the visit to the ER.

item.title: Report E-2023120101
item.description:
Report E-2023120101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of about 1 cup of SSI 150 (UN1268), a petroleum distillate product by Solvent Systems happened at the XDP Terminal. The 55gal drum was punctured during loading by a forklift at the XDP terminal which caused the release to the dock when it was unloaded. Upon reviewing the SDS with the terminal, it was determined that the staff could safely clean the spill in the ventilated dock while donning skin/eye PPE, using absorbents, keeping the material away from ignition sources, and avoiding eating/drinking/smoking near the material. The undamaged product was transferred to a new 55gal poly drum. Total waste content, being the spilled product, empty drum, and spent absorbents, were put in the empty drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was being mishandled while unloading which resulted in spillage when box fell to the ground. The caps of the bottles were broken and product was not salvagable. DescribePack: All caps to the bottles were broken. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Area was blocked off, package was placed in the hazmat bin, area was cleaned, operation continued.

item.title: Report E-2023120077
item.description:
Report E-2023120077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, the box was near the tail of the truck and was discovered to be leaking. The material was absorbed by the fiberboard carton and was damp. Investigation determined that the likely cause of damage was that the glass container inside the carton had broken due to excessive vibration on the tail of the truck. Once the carton had arrived back to the terminal, the material had dried from the carton. Due to the hazard of material, the packaging specs were not able to be obtained.

  • Description: a 2gal release of 2 stroke motor oil (UN1203) from 2-1gal poly bottles on the trailer. The cause was due to a forklift accident. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and proper PPE. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 10gal metal drum in the facilities waste area.

item.title: Report X-2023120037
item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED NOTICEABLY WET. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE UNDECLARED AND HAD SPILLAGE. 4 X 1 GALLON OF RES CARE FAILED DUE TO BE IMPROPER PACKAGE AND SPILLED. NO OP-900 AND NO PAPERWORK. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2023110825
item.description:
Report X-2023110825

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET AND UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE FOUND THAT 1 OF 4 GALLON BOTTLES WERE SHIPPED WITH A LOOSE CAP. LEAKAGE FROM THIS PACKAGE CAUSED AN INCIDENT, RESULTING IN AN INJURY TO AN EMPLOYEE. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP CAP/ LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.
